channel.title: Replacing Cache
channel.description: I have my jar client made and ready to go now i wanna put it online so people can download, basically where they click a link and it downloads automatically, i dont want my file to be a .rar file just the jar client it's self. like this.

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:25, topic:551549”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670465.msg4483402#msg4483402 date=1432000104]

Tank nation, don’t come on here and give us some obscure issues and then get mad at people attempting to help. That’s how you receive no help…

Every. Single. Time. That I’ve been on one of your topics, you post the minimal information about your error.
That does not help us, nor does it make anyone think you’re even attempting to solve it… Because it doesn’t look like you are to me.
To me, it looks like you bitch and complain (Pardon my french) about an error until someone physically gives you the answer… And if it’s not copy pasteable, you bitch some more.

I’m done helping you until you actually show you’re trying.
Bye.

I don’t complain about anything, tired of ignorant people thinking they gotta be in all my shit all the time.
[/quote]

I suggest you actually consider learning some Java before you make a server. Just saying, bub.[/quote]

Figured it out no need.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:551549”]It does not need to say “2.0”. You should be perfectly fine with it saying “2”… What could possibly be the reasoning behind needing a “minor” version? No one sees that value anyways…
Again… Look at the primitive data types.
It’s really not hard to change the 3 letters “int” into the 6 letters “double”.[/quote]

it’s important because the 2.0 version is needed to download but its not,the version “2” is the one being placed in the C: drive which again the server will not run unless its 2.0 version of the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

It does not need to say “2.0”. You should be perfectly fine with it saying “2”… What could possibly be the reasoning behind needing a “minor” version? No one sees that value anyways…
Again… Look at the primitive data types.
It’s really not hard to change the 3 letters “int” into the 6 letters “double”.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:551549”]You’ve been at this all night when all you have to do is remove a period and a 0?

        private final int VERSION = 2.0; // Version of cache

That’s your error. Again, Integers accept whole numbers.
If you would like to use a decimal, make it a double.

You should take a look at the Primitive Data Types.[/quote]
i know removing the period “.” would get rid of the error but it needs to say 2.0 for the new cache to download , how can i make this a double then? so i can set it to 2.0?

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’ve been at this all night when all you have to do is remove a period and a 0?

        private final int VERSION = 2.0; // Version of cache

That’s your error. Again, Integers accept whole numbers.
If you would like to use a decimal, make it a double.

You should take a look at the Primitive Data Types.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:551549”]Read the error…
You supplied a double “2.0”, and the variable is declared as an integer, which accepts whole numbers. A.K.A “2”.[/quote]

i’ve been on this all night, i cannot figure it out where is the mistake ill try to fix it.

[code]import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.net.URLConnection;
import java.net.URL;
import java.util.zip.ZipEntry;
import java.util.zip.ZipInputStream;

import sign.signlink;

public class CacheDownloader {

    private client client;

    private final int BUFFER = 1024;

    /*
     * Only things you need to change
     *
     */
    private final int VERSION = 2.0; // Version of cache
    private String cacheLink = "https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com"; // Link to cache

    private String fileToExtract = getCacheDir() + getArchivedName();

    public CacheDownloader(client client) {
            this.client = client;
    }

    private void drawLoadingText(String text) {
            client.drawLoadingText(35, text);
            System.out.println(text);
    }


    private void drawLoadingText(int amount, String text) {
            client.drawLoadingText(amount, text);
            System.out.println(text);
    }

    private String getCacheDir() {
            return signlink.findcachedir();
    }

    private String getCacheLink() {
            return cacheLink;
    }

    private int getCacheVersion() {
            return VERSION;
    }

    public CacheDownloader downloadCache() {
            try {
            File location = new File(getCacheDir());
            File version = new File(getCacheDir() + "/cacheVersion" + getCacheVersion() + ".dat");
            
            if(!location.exists()) {
                    //drawLoadingText("Downloading Cache Please wait...");
                    downloadFile(getCacheLink(), getArchivedName());

                    unZip();
                    System.out.println("UNZIP");

                    BufferedWriter versionFile = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(getCacheDir() + "/cacheVersion" + getCacheVersion() + ".dat"));
                    versionFile.close();
            } else {
                    if(!version.exists()) {
                            //drawLoadingText("Downloading Cache Please wait...");
                            downloadFile(getCacheLink(), getArchivedName());

                            unZip();
                            System.out.println("UNZIP");

                            BufferedWriter versionFile = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(getCacheDir() + "/cacheVersion" + getCacheVersion() + ".dat"));
                            versionFile.close();

                    } else {
                            return null;
                    }
            }
            } catch(Exception e) {

            }
            return null;
    }
    
    private void downloadFile(String adress, String localFileName) {
            OutputStream out = null;
            URLConnection conn;
            InputStream in = null;
            
            try {

                    URL url = new URL(adress);
                    out = new BufferedOutputStream(
                            new FileOutputStream(getCacheDir() + "/" +localFileName)); 

                    conn = url.openConnection();
                    in = conn.getInputStream(); 
            
                    byte[] data = new byte[BUFFER]; 
    
                    int numRead;
                    long numWritten = 0;
                    int length = conn.getContentLength();

    
                    while((numRead = in.read(data)) != -1) {
                            out.write(data, 0, numRead);
                            numWritten += numRead;

                                int percentage = (int)(((double)numWritten / (double)length) * 100D);
                            drawLoadingText(percentage, "Ardi: Downloading Cache [" + percentage + "%]");

                    }

                    System.out.println(localFileName + "\t" + numWritten);
                    drawLoadingText("Ardi: Unzipping...");

            } catch (Exception exception) {
                    exception.printStackTrace();
            } finally {
                    try {
                            if (in != null) {
                                    in.close();
                            }
                            if (out != null) {
                                    out.close();
                            }
                    } catch (IOException ioe) {
                    }
            }

    }

    private String getArchivedName() {
            int lastSlashIndex = getCacheLink().lastIndexOf('/');
            if (lastSlashIndex >= 0 
                    && lastSlashIndex < getCacheLink().length() -1) { 
                    return getCacheLink().substring(lastSlashIndex + 1);
            } else {
                    System.err.println("error retreiving archivaed name.");
            }
            return "";
    }



    private void unZip() {

        try {
                InputStream in = 
                new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(fileToExtract));
            ZipInputStream zin = new ZipInputStream(in);
            ZipEntry e;

            while((e=zin.getNextEntry()) != null) {

                           if(e.isDirectory()) {
                    (new File(getCacheDir() + e.getName())).mkdir();
                           } else {

                if (e.getName().equals(fileToExtract)) {
                    unzip(zin, fileToExtract);
                    break;
                }
                           unzip(zin, getCacheDir() + e.getName());
                }
                System.out.println("unzipping2 " + e.getName());
            }
            zin.close();

        } catch(Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

    private void unzip(ZipInputStream zin, String s) 
            throws IOException {

            FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(s);
            //System.out.println("unzipping " + s);
            byte [] b = new byte[BUFFER];
            int len = 0;

            while ((len = zin.read(b)) != -1) {
                    out.write(b,0,len);
            }
            out.close();
    }

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Read the error…
You supplied a double “2.0”, and the variable is declared as an integer, which accepts whole numbers. A.K.A “2”.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:551549”]That’s what a Cache Downloader/Updater is. You change the version and it downloads the new cache…
Check in your cachedownloader to see if it has a version.[/quote]

Yes it is set to version 1: so i need to set it to version 3? correct just put a 3 instead of one?

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s what a Cache Downloader/Updater is. You change the version and it downloads the new cache…
Check in your cachedownloader to see if it has a version.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:551549”]No reason you need to put it into a .rar

You can literally upload the .jar file to any site that allowed you to upload the .rar file.
Pro tip: If you have your own website, you can just use FileZilla (or equivalent) to upload the .jar there. Then it would be like this to download
http://YourWebsite.com/client.jar (Assuming you uploaded it to the root of the site)[/quote]

Okay i got it now, thanks! Only one problem im having atm is that the old cache is being put in the correct folder as this, C:\Users\home-user i need the new cache to go there and replace that one.

Read full topic

item.title: Replacing Cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

No reason you need to put it into a .rar

You can literally upload the .jar file to any site that allowed you to upload the .rar file.
Pro tip: If you have your own website, you can just use FileZilla (or equivalent) to upload the .jar there. Then it would be like this to download
http://YourWebsite.com/client.jar (Assuming you uploaded it to the root of the site)

Read full topic
